body_html: Oh, maybe it's not so bad then: in create_inception_graph() you can specify {BOTTLENECK_TENSOR_NAME: some_placeholder_tensor} as the input_map argument. That way, you can define the placeholder to be whatever shape you want it to be in retrain.py, and you won't have to modify the original binary graph!
body_text: Oh, maybe it's not so bad then: in create_inception_graph() you can specify {BOTTLENECK_TENSOR_NAME: some_placeholder_tensor} as the input_map argument. That way, you can define the placeholder to be whatever shape you want it to be in retrain.py, and you won't have to modify the original binary graph!
body: Oh, maybe it's not so bad then: in `create_inception_graph()` you can specify `{BOTTLENECK_TENSOR_NAME: some_placeholder_tensor}` as the `input_map` argument. That way, you can define the placeholder to be whatever shape you want it to be in `retrain.py`, and you won't have to modify the original binary graph!
